job_purpose: Designing, developing, and testing embedded software and control systems for the Corvo family of autonomous systems at SYPAQ in Port Melbourne.
keywords: Manufacture and test of embedded products
job_duties_and_responsibilities: Design, develop, and test embedded software and control systems for the Corvo family of autonomous systems
Demonstrate strong C/C++, Java, and scripting skills
Work on embedded development using Linux and/or ARM platforms
Manage manufacture and test processes for embedded products
Engage in the full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Utilize expertise in Ground Control Systems and Human Machine Interfaces
Apply knowledge in image and signal processing
Work with tactical data links, GPS/GNSS technologies, and radio communications
Utilize version control and task tracking software such as the Atlassian suite
Adhere to regulated software domains standards in Defence, Medical, and Automotive sectors
required_qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering
Ability to hold and maintain Australian Defence Security Clearance NV1 Minimum
Ability to work in a team or independently
preferred_qualifications: Experience with Ground Control Systems and Human Machine Interface’s
Experience with image and/or signal processing
Experience with version control and task tracking software (such as the Atlassian suite of tools)
Experience in regulated software domains (Defence, Medical, Automotive)
company_details: SYPAQ is a world-leading innovator in the development and delivery of autonomous systems and complex technical projects. They specialize in secure networks, information and cyber security governance architecture, and Certification and Accreditation of systems in Federal Government and Defence contexts.
